definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc

sentences.english: Some one tampers with my diary.
Star-hyun in his diary painted a portrait of Helen, to write poems.
sentences.chinese: 星鉉在自己的日記本里繪美玲的肖像，寫情詩。

sentences.english: You can use a simple notebook, some white paper or a diary.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用記事本，日記本或者幾張白紙來記錄。

sentences.english: I took back the diary and we dashed off.
sentences.chinese: 我趕緊拿回日記本匆匆離去。

sentences.english: Among all the presents that I have ever received, I like my diary book best.
sentences.chinese: 在所有我收過的禮物中，我最喜歡我的日記本。

sentences.english: I have tons of journals filled with nothing but scribble.
sentences.chinese: 我有很多日記本什麼都沒寫，除了亂寫亂畫。

sentences.english: Get a Moleskine Notebook and carry it in your back pocket wherever you go.
sentences.chinese: 買個日記本，無論去哪裏都帶上它。

sentences.english: Diary books bound with the novel's cover image became the most popular kind in Chongqing.
sentences.chinese: 以紅巖爲封面的日記本成了重慶最流行的東西。

sentences.english: The diary comes complete with a gold-coloured ballpoint pen.
sentences.chinese: 這個日記本要是配上一支金色圓珠筆就完美了。

sentences.english: It was not until I picked it up that I realized that it was a diary.
sentences.chinese: 把它撿起來時才發現原來是一個日記本。

sentences.english: Everything about fire and measuring cup's things could be in that diary.
sentences.chinese: 所有關於大火和量杯的事情都記錄在那個日記本里。

sentences.english: Use the notebook and the book to look for it again?
sentences.chinese: 用日記本和那書再次去找它？

sentences.english: She mounted the photograph on the back of her diary book.
sentences.chinese: 她把照片裱貼在她的日記本上。

definition: to overturn trunks and boxes/to make a thorough search (idiom)
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
unable to sit or stand still (out of nervousness etc) (idiom)
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
alarm (e.g. burglar or fire alarm)/warning device
